column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent

#Text=In 2006 , I did n't run to become the typical politician who leaves for Ottawa and forgets about the people and organizations that elected them ; or the politician who uses this position for their own gain ; that 's not what this community needs or deserves .
#Text=As an MP , I will continue to fight for the issues that are important to Canadian families , to ensure that my neighbours are getting the help they need from their government .
#Text=Are you satisfied with your time as MP ?
#Text=What would be the biggest highlights of the roughly two years since the last election ?
#Text=I am proud of the issues that I have been able to address in the House of Commons and in my community .
#Text=I seconded Jack Layton 's Environmental Protection Bill which tackles climate change and sets measurable targets to reduce carbon emissions every year .

#Text=I introduced a bill on Amateur Sport Financing to give athletes a helping hand and worked on the Subcommittee on International Human Rights to address abuses such as the case of Omar Khadr , Huseyincan Celil and Japanese Comfort Women .

#Text=In Hamilton , I have worked to help families with CPP , EI , Immigration and Revenue Canada issues , had funding restored to local youth programmes through Canada Summer Jobs , helped eligible constituents collect over $ 750,000 through the Disability Tax Credit and hosted seminars to help people apply , co-hosted a public forum to raise awareness for Turtle Ponds , the environmentally sensitive wetlands , started a petition and postcard campaign in support of Billy Mason 's family and demanded that the Conservative Government establish a National DNA Databank for Missing Persons , ensured that the entire Pakistan Team could attend the 2008 World Kabaddi Tournament held in Hamilton this August
#Text=The biggest disappointment ?
#Text=It is difficult to be in opposition and watch the Conservative Government and the supporting Liberal Opposition push through legislation that actively works against ordinary Canadians .
#Text=People elect a representative to help them , not hurt them .
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=I have heard from a lot of people that their big concerns are the economy , health care and the environment .
#Text=Is there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?

#Text=I think the biggest wall the NDP comes up against is that people are disenfranchised from politics because Conservatives and Liberals claim " The NDP has no chance of forming a government , so do n't waste your vote on them .

#Text= However , in the last two elections , 1.5 million more Canadians voted NDP - more than doubling the NDP 's representation in the House of Commons .
